definitions.definition: In terms of morals or ethics .
examples: Morally , it is a difficult issue to deal with.

definitions.definition: In keeping of requirements of morality .
To all intents and purposes ; practically .
Used to clarify that a statement is made in analogy , and every detail may not be strictly true.
examples: In the short exact sequence 0 → q A → r B → s C → t 0 {\displaystyle 0\xrightarrow {q} A\xrightarrow {r} B\xrightarrow {s} C\xrightarrow {t} 0} , B {\displaystyle B} is morally A × C {\displaystyle A\times C} , even if in reality the sequence may fail to split.

main_definition: In terms of morals or ethics .
secondary_definitions: In keeping of requirements of morality .
To all intents and purposes ; practically .
( mathematics ) Used to clarify that a statement is made in analogy , and every detail may not be strictly true.
